_-d_TLHdllwfx7ZfCRPmMA.text: Awful Service!  Nice looking place but wait staff completely blamed kitchen for a botched order, and then shrugged their shoulders.  Food is just okay - but the overall experience makes it not worth coming to.  Be prepared to wait a long time for your food.

xYLvW8BQp1Be5IDnWu924A.text: We stopped into the Blue Boar for drinks and dessert. The food and drinks were great but the service was slower than I would have liked. I believe they were training a new server.

Z8pAP3QdSealwZ9uQPYCWw.text: Summary: an English interpretation of a French interpretation of American BBQ.The positives:London needs more BBQ restaurants. So thank you to the proprietors for giving it a go. In fact, just because it's BBQ, I will increase my rating from 2 to 3 stars. Done. The layout and design of the bar area is great: lots of small seating areas, hidden nooks and corners, big windows. All drinks are served  with a mix of nuts and olives. Call me crazy but I prefer not to mix the sweet and salty nuts in the same jar, but for the "mix-desert-and-main-course-crowd" out there it might be appealing. The food:I was part of a very large, very hungry group so we tried a significant portion of the items on the menu. Easily the best thing on the menu were the ribs. An order comes with a combination of large chunky ribs which are a bit chewy and some smaller ribs at the bottom of the jar. The smaller ribs were much more flavourful and benefited from the excess sauce from it's larger brothers. However compared to good southern BBQ style ribs, these ribs deserve a 4.5 out of 10, at best.The pulled pork, lamb, goat (hidden behind the label "Somerset Kid") all tasted basically the same and were served with an easily missable side of BBQ sauce. Sautéed mushrooms were a greasy and flavourless. The Pork chops and rib eye got poor reviews from a fellow diner, chewiness being the main complaint for the steak. The only BBQ-related sauce on the menu was the BBQ sauce mentioned earlier. Any self-respecting BBQ restaurant must offer a variety of tomato and vinegar-based BBQ and hot sauces. If I wanted Bernaise and Peppercorn sauce I could and would go to any standard steak restaurant in London. The Conclusion:Go to the bar, have some free nuts and order some ribs, and you will have covered Blue Boar's best aspects.

rZweY_Fm-qAtAUS7fz7tog.text: I've hung out at the bar area of the Blue Boar at least two or three times in the evening with my co-workers. It's a very nice, upscale bar, with a good atmosphere for chatting, but it's incredibly expensive for drinks. I'm not a huge fan of some of the decor, though, like the lamps made of cowboy boots. But some areas aren't too bad; you'll find a lot of nooks and crannies in the various tables and seating available. Go for it if you don't mind the price and it's your taste.

683-piqjKbsGNeHDF21Q1Q.text: Riding on a hop-on/hop-off tour bus, we passed this place and it seemed like a respite from the double-decker bus crowd. Smart paneling, hushed interior, and nice views out of large picture windows. Food was terrific--the beetroot salad was dressed perfectly and had plenty of goat cheese, soup of the day remained hot for what seemed like hours, and the steak sandwich was cooked to perfection. It's a tad pricey, but not considering the area. I'd definitely return.

TfTAZ9wT87f5X3CA6IfFIQ.text: So we are from the Deep South (Nashville, TN). We know BBQ. Our family of six ate here on our trip to Europe. Our meal was FANTASTIC and was only surpassed by OUTSTANDING service from Ian. Our table had: the ribs appetizer, the sea bass, the fried chicken (2), the kids cheeseburger, the ribeye steak and we shared some asparagus. We all loved our food. The ribs were so very tasty. Ian brought us finger bowels and lots of napkins for the ribs. He even accommodated my iced tea request as well as my son's request for a Caesar salad even though neither was on the menu. Ian was an endearing conversationalist and made us feel so welcome. We were so delighted at the quality of our meal and the attentiveness of our service that I asked to speak to the manager. This place is connected to the InterContinental Hotel but is far from boring tasteless overpriced hotel food. This will rank as one of our best meals.

HdwXryGWOmmY9p5zmXNxPQ.text: This is one of those places that makes me wish I could give a zero star review. It was surreal. We were just looking for a comfortable place for our family of five to grab an early dinner...happened upon the Blue Boar on our way back to the hotel. There was a large sign out in front of the restaurant announcing a Sunday Roast available that night. That sounded pretty good so we went in to order. First of all, they acted like they didn't know what to do when a customer actually came in. We were ignored for the longest time. Then when the waiter finally showed up he looked at me as if I had three eyes when I asked for the Sunday Roast. He'd never heard of it, didn't know what it was and announced they didn't have anything like that. I mentioned there was a sign in front of his restaurant promoting it, and he ignored me. We then ordered hummus for the kids from the menu. He said, what is that? FOR REAL. He said they didn't have anything like that. We showed him the menu where it plainly stated Hummus. It all went downhill from there. Very mediocre to down right awful food, horrendous service, WEIRD staff -- it was like we were from another planet. Please stay away from this poor excuse for a restaurant. The only silver lining is that the whole family still is having a good laugh at the expense of the Blue Boar -- when considering a new restaurant now we always say, "Well, it can't be as bad as the Blue Boar!" And it is true, nothing can compare to this craphole.

a52VlgcVCQmVkf9jsQMQXw.text: So I had the pleasure of going on a date to this lovely bar come restaurant. Its a charming, slightly more sophisticated bar in an area with many pubs. It's not the cheapest of places, but the quality of the drinks is high and the service is very attentive. I liked the ease with which we were able to set up a tab and order drinks, without any fuss. We both fancied the old fashioned and boy do they do a mighty fine one! It was more orangey than I'm used to, but I really liked it, especially with the cherry which sat on the top of the ice! Yes sir! I'm intrigued to see what the food is like, so I reckon it won't be long before I find aother excuse to venture back...

Uv4isja8so5CIQkgY2BY6g.text: Went for a late dinner, and didn't feel like wandering out so we hit the hotel restaurant I had a burger and the mushroom Mac n cheese. The burger was very good and the mac n cheese was okay. It sounded good with mushrooms, but there were too many of them and they were too large (should have been diced). Service was good, and the prices were good considering it was in the hotel. It worked in a pinch, and I would go there again under the same circumstances.On a separate note, I ordered the club sandwich from room service on a separate night, which comes out of the Blue Boar kitchen, and that was outstanding.

plvxfJ5Lt0tR2NvLD04vtQ.text: I believe they are a restaurant to a hotel- so they're on the pricey side. I was a tourist in London and didn't find any restaurants in the neighborhood until I ran into the Blue Boar. Luckily, the food was good. I ordered a soup for an appetizer and a burger for my main course. The service was really good. Everyone seemed really friendly and genuinely glad we were there. If I'm ever back in London I'd probably go back.

z9rqlCn5-__pTF25hEJxNw.text: I'd been looking forward to lunch at The Blue Boar (I walk past it every day), and was not disappointed by the interior which was clean, slightly corporate but nice.We ate in the restaurant part out the back, but unfortunately the food was less than spectacular. I had the burger, and the best part of it was the toasted bun (brioche). The burger meat reminded me of something like GBK, not cheap but cheerful. The chips were thin-cut and sparse, served in a metal dish which conducted away their heat. There wasn't anything to complain about, but nothing to shout about either. One of my companions had the sea bass, which got better feedback.I ended on sticky toffee pudding, and found it very rich (but not overwhelmingly so), and the honeycomb ice cream went well with it.In all, the food was perfectly edible, but for the price and the availability of the Caxton Grill 2 minutes up the road, not somewhere I can recommend.

1uAS8yKfklXkKwIoBWK_eg.text: Insanely overpriced. 44 GBP for two cocktails (vodka on the rocks and a rum & coke). The bartender was very nice but nothing can make up for the robbery in pricing.

ERvIvLyk0zzPKhszQVzkEw.text: Okay.  As a diamond Hilton honors person I am truly embarrassed that such a bar would be part of such an amazing Hilton property. The hotel and it's staff is amazing with great service in every way. The blue boar bar is crap! I had to just about tackle the server to get our order in. Then they sat on the order while the bar tender cleaned glasses. I got a shot of scotch that was so small I needed my glasses to see it. After I was done four waiters walked by and No-one asked me if I wanted another glass. The couple that sat next to me had the same horrible experience. At one point he said "is like they are going out of their way to give horrible service!"  Stay away!

LRpQjfBWGUhYVm3K3N6MYQ.text: Don't waste your time... Terrible service beyond anything I have ever seen and it is extremely over priced. Food menu is below par and staff is horrendous... Don't waste your money or time honestly. You'll find a better experience, drinks and food at a local McDonalds.

Cb8OIkBEirZP9PIzdhgZRQ.text: Worst service ever... Sat down, no waiter ever came. Had to request menus and to order. The waiter never checked up on our meal. The food was below average. Cool, traditional environment... But thats all they having going for them. Clearly miss managed.

NYpZAYT-6beMtFNKFoihkA.text: I was on a mission to impress a date, and was given the task of booking a brunch venue (seems my foodie knowledge was being put to the test).  After researching a number of restaurants and getting suggestions from fellow Yelpers, I decided on this one because the mains featured a wide selection of BBQ meats, fish and other goodies (rather than the usual standard breakfast fare).  At £35/person, I thought this was a great choice for a boozy brunch.  The oak interior was quite posh and classy, the seafood was served on top of a carved ice sculpture, and our mains were served on silver platters.  I've never felt so classy eating beans out of a silver cup!The unlimited Bucks Fizz and Bloody Marys (yep, unlimited) sat on a separate drink table, and you can get as many as you'd like.  I think I went through 4, which was enough for me.Off on the side was a buffet display of assorted of salads, chilled seafood (mussels, clams, prawns, smoked salmon), terrine, charcuterie, nuts and pickles, dips and condiments, though I was looking forward to their caesar salad station, which wasn't set up.  Not sure why... not that big of on issue, as I thoroughly enjoyed everything else they had to offer.  I think my favorite was the smoked chicken and creme fraiche salad, and the chilled prawns.After feasting your eyes on the appetizers, keep in mind that a full-size main dish is still being prepared in the kitchen, so don't fill up too much on all the goodies.  The main dishes featured a number of American BBQ smoked meats (ribs, pulled pork, burger, etc), fish, eggs benny and 2 vegetarian options.  I opted for the pulled pork, and my date went for the burger (the waitress did say that the ribs were very popular).The pulled pork arrived on a silver platter, with a side of beans in a cup, sauce on the side, and 2 freshly baked thyme rolls.  The pork was nice and tender but dry in the sense that it wasn't basking in any sauce.  It wasn't as smokey as it could have been, I've definitely had better, but was still a decent dish.  As much as I do like pulled pork, this isn't something I can eat a whole lot of, I usually can't handle too much smokey meat, especially when lots of other food is involved.  In hindsight, this was clearly the wrong choice for me, especially during the lunch hour, and probably would have gone for the sea bass, eggs benny, or the roast.  I'm sure if I asked nicely, the waitress would have given me a different dish, but I didn't want to bother her. My date finished off most of his burger.. I tried a bite, but to be honest, I was too full to pay much attention to it!  I like my patties cooked medium rare so its nice and juicy, but I *think* the patty was well done..?  If burgers are your thing, then by all means you should try it, but I think there are several other burger establishments which serve up a meaner burger.With whatever room we had left, we rolled on over to the dessert table, which was splashed with 3-4 different types of macarons, cakes, tarts, elderflower creme brulee, strawberry mousse, GIANT meringues with assorted fruits... I can't remember it all, but there's something for everyone, especially if you have a sweet tooth. Overall, I had a fantastic time at the restaurant, the servers were nice, but the highlight really was the guy playing his guitar and singing at the entrance of the restaurant.  It was seriously a nice surprise, and I kept getting distracted by all the songs he kept playing.  He takes requests too!At £35/person for an unlimited boozy brunch with some great music on the side, I say this is a win.

SO-TrFOH1y6ZOBtweytU-A.text: Stumbled across this place on a wet autumn London day when my default nearby sandwich bar was out of action due to power outage.My initial impressions were (a) this is new - pass by relatively frequently and haven't noticed before (b) big windows and spacious (c) reasonably priced lunch options - baguette with full service not much more than pre-packed option at nearby takeouts.Whilst waiting for lunch I discovered ... from the name of the free WiFi - it's attached to adjacent IHG hotel (Intercontinental).I was then surprised checking the reviews to find a stream of vitriol from The Guardian's Critic - mainly it would seem for the "crime" of not being "authentic", rather than anything substantive.I prefer to trust my own instincts, so will revisit for proper meal - or their "boozy brunch" perhaps that other Yelpers have mentioned - sometime.

H1v3h_NsphBlPjonAg6Tpw.text: We really enjoyed this upscale pub. As we walked up to this pub we saw lots of business suit wearing customers and we were a little worried about my jeans and Polo shirt. It was just the after work crowd. We were greeted warmly and given a prime table near the front windows. This is a very nicely decorated place. Looks very new, bright and the front is all windows. I had a very good homemade soup of the day and braised Ox cheek. My girlfriend had the chicken in a basket. Which is a half fried chicken and chips. It was cooked perfectly. A little warning though, it was quite spicy. My girlfriend said that her lips were burning. My Ox cheek was very good and so tender. They gave me a steak knife to cut it with but I just pulled it apart with my fork. It tasted better than the best pot roast that I have ever had.I can highly recommend this restaurant. Something to keep in mind is, that culturally they are not quick to bring you the bill even if they  know that you have finished. They don't want anyone to think that they are rushing you out of the restaurant. So you may have to flag them down and specifically ask for the check. They are not trying to be rude.

06f2dUxUSNvyjZCW53Recw.text: Went on a Saturday morning at 9:45 - nobody was there and doors were locked. Very disappointed.

6zXxiuiQ_bntiFhea-13jA.text: Where I come from, BBQ is served on wax paper.  In an unremarkable building.  With sawdust on the floor, more likely than not.  Blue Boar is quite the opposite.Imagine swank interiors with random bronze sculptures.  A wine chiller ice sculpture.  Copious amounts of ribs served in a silver bucket.  It should in every way offend my delicate Texan sensibilities.  But it doesn't.  Because it is awesome.I went to Blue Boar for the Sunday brunch.  £35 per person with unlimited Bucks Fizz or Bloody Marys.  What?!  And there's a starter bar loaded with various salads, fresh seafood, meat platters, etc.  And then you get to pick a main and various sides to go with.  AND THEN there's a dessert bar where if you have any room (you won't have room, but you'll stuff some dessert in there anyway) you can sample loads of different items.The highlights for me were the smoked chicken and granny smith apple salad they had on the starter bar, the chunky chips, which were so fluffy on the inside yet crisp on the outside, and a sampled rib which I didn't order, but which I snagged out of my friend's silver bucket.  Sadly, my main, the meatloaf with fried egg, was, compared to everyone else's mains, a pretty sad affair.  Imagine a tiny slab of spam, fried in a pan with an overdone egg.  Just a major downer after all the other awesomeness and all the lovely mains my cohorts had in front of them.But!  Still amazing value, really good food (meatloaf aside), and a bedazzled gentleman with a guitar regaling us with the best of glee and soft rock hits for 2.5 hours?  I'm sold.

zTJMTehKQvSyaShtznj9sA.text: For me brunch means breakfast and lunch foods mixed with copious amounts of booze. So when I find a place that advertises brunch with unlimited Bloody Marys and Mimosas (that's Buck's Fizz to you Brits), I'm willing to give it a go.When I booked it, it was £50 per person, but they lowered the price recently to £35. Which was really an added bonus. I don't know if it's a permanent change, but it's well worth the price either way. We were slightly concerned showing up that the "unlimited" wouldn't be as unlimited as we often like (you know, so you're drinking enough for two), but we were pleasantly surprised when we saw the drinks were sitting near the buffet to be picked up whenever you wanted another one. That's a +1 star right there! Also on the way in there was a man playing soft rock and hits from Glee on his guitar which really added a special feeling to the day (especially when you've had enough booze to start singing along).How it works: There is a buffet set up with salads, shellfish and meats. There were five pre-made salads and a "make-your-own" caesar salad station. (Which sounds and looks cool, but it's a lot of work, I'd probably prefer having a premade caesar for ease.) Most of the stuff on the buffet was pretty awesome, especially the sliced meats available. There were also plenty of prawns and cold shellfish to go around.Once you're full up on the buffet, they bring you rmains around. You've ordered these when you've arrived with a few sides to share. Now you're quite full, but you tuck in anyway because the food is fantastic. I had the trio of eggs. Basically three different egg benedicts. And they were all tasty. But I couldn't finish. The smokehouse does barbeque, so two people ordered that. There was a pulled pork (which looked fantastic) and these amazingly delicious smoked pork ribs served in a silver bucket (I tried one, and they were luscious.) The next table over had the roast (which that day was beef) and it was served perfectly medium rare and also looked fantastic.At this point you've had a lot to drink and eat and you're stuffed. But there's an entire table of desserts as well. With things ranging from macarons to cheesecakes to chocolate pots and creme brulee. There are so many desserts and they look so amazing that you want to try them all. But you're stuffed. But you try anyway. And many of them are good. They weren't all amazing (even if they look it) which is probably why it only gets four stars.Will I be back? Yes most definitely. I might even try it for dinner. The barbeque was amazing, even if it was served in a place that looked way too upscale to be serving ribs and pulled pork.

diDdQb4MHoVC_MuxZIVyvw.text: Great service, classy but not stuffy, delicious food, dark warm atmosphere, cushy chairs

yZqd9qXMAWlYt3C4Qib8xA.text: Fantastic location, even better drinks. Had the opportunity to try the Blue Boar while staying at the Conrad on vacation. The inside was new and refreshing. The wait staff were superb. The Blue Boar caters to the after work crowd and is decorated with various political caricatures. We brought our daughter for a glass of lemonade while we waited for our taxi to Paddington (she was the only child in the location). Carlos, the manager, drew pictures with my daughter and magically appeared with a box of crayons to color in the pictures. If you want to impress a five year old bring her a box of crayons. This is a great location and I highly recommend it to anyone that is fortunate enough to find themselves in Westminster.

hajGSP0p_R0D_b4O411u7w.text: Horrible Christmas Dinner!  I had reserved for Christmas dinner based on the menu shown online and also clicked the box for "A la carte" when reserving thru Open Table. I was put off when the restaurant called me asking for a credit card to confirm and stated we would have to pay £40 each if we cancelled.  Normally that is stated on most websites and by Open Table but I went with it.  When we showed up to the restaurant we were shocked and disappointed to hear it was buffet only.  Not a fan of buffets!The buffet was horrendous!  Everything was cold and dried out.  Nothing was representative from their menu.  It was like the horrible family buffet I've dreaded all my life...bland turkey, over cooked ham, chunky potatoes that could have been used as hockey pucks.  Very disappointing!  We choked down of few pieces, closed our tab and moved to their separate bar.  The bartenders nearly made up for the horrible dinner.I might give them a chance next time I am in London to see if their regular menu is worth the decent reviews they have on Yelp.

u0UttK1pnkoKYl041NzpDA.text: Good cocktails and impressed with the service very friendly. One drawback which was unfortunate was a mouldy piece of fruit in the cocktail, however dealt with extremely professionally and would happily recommend the service still. Unlucky more than poor cocktails in that account. However at £14 a cocktail I expect it not to happen really, but will let them off due to the good way it was handled.

OwFgB2L3U5mubX5tn4dbyA.text: Having left dinner plans to the last minute, This was one of the only restaurants left with availability, supposedly a new American restaurant in a brand new hotel. A new BBQ restaurant that I'd never heard of?! Hmmm. I was a bit unsure, after reading some reviews trashing their service but decided to give it a go.The service, I can safely say, was wonderful. Our servers were all lovely. The quality of the food...well, there was nothing WRONG with it, it was fine, but I'd say overpriced for what was definitely  not authentic American BBQ, as advertised. I had the pulled lamb, my co-diners had pulled pork and the pork belly. The pork and lamb just weren't spicy enough and the pork belly was over salty with not a lot of other flavours prevalent.  It's also officially the first time I've eaten BBQ from pure silver serving bowls and trays--my family would undoubtedly get a kick out of seeing such an informal food being served in such a formal way.You can get much better BBQ for a lot less of the price at other places. The only redeeming feature, aside from the service, was the fact that the hotel was absolutely lovely.

GJmPuvM4MwqdpHBejJ1ZGw.text: The environment is great and very popular. The presentation of our fish and chips was above average. The beer was very descent as well.

5y7Aryb_mZqCr7n3hqeXdw.text: Absolutely loved this bar.  Food was excellent but cocktails perfect!   Very well made and service great

G5HYQ0zCB_FaO_alZlpN8w.text: Gave this place a shot as I stay in the Conrad often and the menu looked appealing.  Was concerned over the mixed reviews, especially on the service, my server was quite attentive and helpful with the menu.  Started with the Carpaccio which was good, with a touch of smoke flavor.  The beef came with these 'treacle cured crisp nuggets' filled with shredded beef which were excellent - actually better than the carpaccio.  Stayed simple with their 'Blue Boar Super Salad with chicken' and a side of 'Red Cabbage with chestnut and date'.  The salad was interesting, avocado, chillies, charred broccoli, french beans, on rocket (arugula).  I still can't decide if I liked it.  It was either undressed or very lightly dressed but still had a flavor I couldn't quite make out, almost a lemon, but not quite.  Chicken was flavorful but a bit dry.  The Red Cabbage might have well been a dessert - way too sweet, couldn't pick out any of the tangy flavor from the cabbage.  Still I ate it all, but truthfully it was like eating warm candy.  I'd certainly come back again and try a few more items, overall was good.  Food: 3 stars (good, but not 'great')Service: 4 stars Ambiance: 4 stars - nice place, clean spaciousValue: 3 starts - prices reasonableOVERALL: 4 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Blue Boar Super Salad with Chicken, in the back the Red Cabbage side.

vOVCqWzTx9vO_JK8TqQ9XA.text: I came here with a group and we sat upstairs and their ciders were pretty tasty.  We enjoyed the atmosphere. They were lacking in vegetarian options but their fish was perfection. Nice and crispy and you will not go hungry if you get it. There was only one waiter helping our large group and at times our waters were empty for long periods.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom

EbB7Xp7-NyNkQDGg8MVZkQ.text: My friends and I were so confused by this restaurant-- but in a good way. We had been wandering around London all day and were starving. We checked out the menu outside and decided to give Blue Boar a try. The inside is super cute and modern. The bathrooms are luxurious. I didn't realize it was attached to a hotel, but everything inside was great! The reason we were confused was because the fanciness and upscale feel did not match menu prices at all, so we felt like we struck gold. My friend and I decided to share their "British sampler" (can't remember the exact name) which is made for two people. It came in a picnic basket displayed absolutely beautifully. It came with a scotch egg, pickled veggies, tuna, bread, apples, finger sandwiches, ham, a whole fruit/cheese/cracker plate AND a berry pudding dessert. We were super impressed and everything tasted great. The best part is it was only 25 pounds, or about $30 USD, which is not bad at all for two people and the amount of food we got. My ONLY complaint was service was slow. Would definitely come back here if I find myself in London again!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Impressive display!
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. British sampler
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom

mZUVVtbLAOVWWgYddvx1dg.text: Ive been here at least 8 times and had excellent service and lovely food. I'm here for breakfast and at times have made special requests like today and they happily comply.  I like the waffles as well as the poached eggs. the tea is nice and the variety is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom

BT-nVl60E72w-NgaG8tkdA.text: Not impressed. Sat for quite a while no one took our order. Looked out the window and saw Sanctuary House. Got served in 30 seconds and the prices are better

MFlJByh5Supo--R_Wdeg-A.text: There are so many awesome places in London- do yourself a favor and don't bother coming here. The service is insanely slow and inattentive; it took them 15 minutes to even acknowledge us after being seated. The servers and bartender were standing around chatting while we were 3 yards away without so much as a glance in our direction. We ordered water to drink and it took them 11 minutes to bring that over, and it was only after we asked them again for it. May I add we were one of three tables in the entire place. We ordered the ham and cheese toastie and roast beef sandwich. Toastie came out with greasy cheese and rubbery- like it had been sitting out for a while, and they forgot the crisps (had to ask for them). Roast beef was okay, nothing special. Would never come back here again, even if the meal was free.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Rubber cheese in the ham and cheese toastie, yuck

DSAZ1cfjbXeliO7--WX76w.text: I had to revisit again since I liked it so much last trip.  This time I had the carrot soup and a Caesar salad with chicken.  Paired with a glass of Gavi.  I couldn't stop eating the carrot soup- it's a must try here.  I was traveling solo so the waiter was super attentive to ensure I wasn't lonely.  Nice :)The portions are massive - maybe offer a lunch combo of half serving of each?Thanks for a great lunch

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Carrot soup and Caesar salad with chicken

H9IsUK_jTAwtCku5GusJYQ.text: Overpriced and underwhelming. I ordered the Wagyu Bacon Cheddar Burger. It was £18 and came with no side items. It was definitely not wagyu beef. The bun was a bit stale. The meager garnishes included one little sliver of bacon and one slice of a pickle the size of a quarter, cut so thin that I could literally see through it. A McDonalds Burger is better than this one - for £16 less. To add insult to injury, this place automatically adds 12.5% in what they call "discretionary service charge". How is it discretionary if it's already printed on my bill? So, I was forced to tip them for a sub-standard meal and average service. oh, but if you're in the holiday spirit and want to tip them more than the mandatory 12.5%, they graciously leave a giant line on the bill for you to write in an additional tip. Ridiculous. Avoid this place.

JkgWHJD92of5V4Adq57cXw.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our Christmas Day luncheon at Blue Boar.   There were Christmas crackers on the table for each of us when we sat down. We were them treated to a gourmet 5 course meal that was delicious and outstanding. Our only trouble was being able to eat our way through it all!!  Service was outstanding and I would highly recommend this restaurant!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom

I2idQUgXviQvanISH8Yobg.text: We stayed at Conrad which is where this bar is located, in Westminster, st james area. After a show, it was late and most places closed but this bar was open for food till 11p on Sat and drinks till 12mdnt. We got mixed sampler for $25 pounds for 2. It came with 6 finger sandwich halves, one with smoked salmon, another with ham and last with pickles. It was ok. Some cheeses, which included brie, crackers and fig jam, it was very good. Mackerel pate and some kind of meat terrine and pickled cauliflower was ok. There was 2 apples which we did not eat. 2 queens pudding which had layers of pudding, blueberry preserve and melange on top. It was good but it was entirely too much food. Food meh.....but nice bar, late hours when you are hungry is important and service was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. After show late hours

EueJr_d-cbaTNtolDC3oPw.text: I ordered the chicken Tika masala and thoroughly enjoyed it.The name of this restaurant pays homage to the large wild boar population in London. You can tell as you walk in how this restaurant respects and caters to its boar patrons by offering small chairs and tables perfect for boars, as well as an all you can eat trough event on Sunday mornings. At first I was confused about the name of the restaurant because I didn't see any blue boars, but the staff explained to me that at midnight all boars turn blue and speak English for a few minutes before going back to their previous state. Would recommend!

Fyc4NQOjLA1FUhJ3wGDfAA.text: Even though I loved staying at this hotel, the Caesar salad I had here was the worst Caesar salad I've ever had! The chicken was very dry, way too many anchovies, and the dressing tasted off. Service was also very slow. Prices were not a deal for the quality of my salad. I wouldn't come here again.

FlUMfWTVTX_73tLoeravrA.text: Our First time here & this Lovely Restaurant features Full Bar service, Wonderful Staff& Excellent Meals & Delightful Service.The restaurant features window seating which is pub style and allows a quiet environment with a fun view of the street. Excellent for people watching The food is quite tasty with a pleasing presentation.Hot and delicious!I will definitely stop back!

3zCpBBtmZKZCipHLvg6Bdw.text: I have been to London three or four times and this has got to be the best eating experience I have had. If I were a local I would be pissed every time a tourist posted a good review of this place. I would want this place to stay undiscovered as long as possible. I showed up at 6:30 and got a table right away. The atmosphere is amazing. You're not dining on top of other people, there is a ton of space. It's super clean and the service was amazing. A little pricy but all things considering I'm surprised it's not more expensive. I got their signature burger which came with fries. Honestly, it was a good burger. Thick with fresh toppings and was cooked perfectly. They brought it to me hot hot hot. My first bit I nearly had to spit back out cuz it was so hot. The bun may have been the best thing about the burger. Again, I can't say enough about this place. It's quiet so conversations are enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Signature house burger, fries, and a Diet Coke.

9ZKrr3EiHe3we0kxGQYp5Q.text: Went here for Christmas Lunch. The meal was a five course meal and we also ordered a bottle of champagne to celebrate. Overall the meal quality was disappointing for the price. Some of the chefs creations (particularly this beef thing rolled in some sort of chalky vegetable to simulate a Yule log I believe) were inappropriate pairings that didn't make sense. Pros: The desserts on the other hand that they had prepared were beautiful. In fact, I've never seen a desert table quite like the one they had prepared. So much beautiful food, taste was still okay, but it was beautiful. Cons: In addition to the items above, the service was actually overly attentive. In fact it was on the intrusive side. Countless times mid conversation we were interrupted.

lXQuU6VZ7t_KK18j4v95VA.text: Nice, upscale pub with excellent fish and chips

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Can't go wrong with F&C in London
Photo of Blue Boar - London, United Kingdom. Can you believe this is gluten free? Yes!!

Dytw5VQ2cIrvsr3-I6-yGw.text: Food was good but service is slow and inattentive . Waited 10 min for the server, water was never refilled, had to ask for silverware and had to remind twice to get my drink. Had 4 different servers. That said, once delivered, food was warm and tasty

QzuDafFAugz8Rmdz95oVow.text: Had high hopes for a cocktail before dinner with my wife. Walked in and grabbed a seat by the window . Nice atmosphere. But we were ignored for 10 minutes. Even the manager just looked at us. Then we had to grab someone who seemed annoyed to have to take our drink order. Another 10 minutes for it to be brought over. Then my drink was a single bourbon which they insisted was a double. Not even close. For 11 euros. Had no intention of making sure I was a satisfied customer. So the service was rotten and I won't go back.

-MQOofmQrkQVVzZb2l5R_A.text: Food was good but the service was interminably slow. After a long day of sightseeing we nearly fell asleep at the table waiting for our waitress, who kept disappearing.
